title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Get Phones Out of the Classroom
items.description: This nationwide, bipartisan trend is one conservatives should embrace.

items.title: Vice President J.D. Vance credits Russia with making concessions in peace talks
items.description: Vice President J.D. Vance said Sunday that Russia has made "significant concessions" in the ongoing negotiations to end its war with Ukraine.

items.title: Midterm elections are as unpredictable as ever, as 2026 looms
items.description: The 2026 midterm elections remain extremely difficult to predict, with House Republicans looking to maintain their currently slim majority.

items.title: ‘A bit of a shock’: Even community colleges, largely nonpartisan commuter schools, are feeling the Trump education crackdown
items.description: A professor in Colorado said that at his school, you don't typically see "the kind of unrest and polarization that you see at other campuses.”

items.title: The Shawn Kemp sentence: He says his truck and cellphone were stolen and he returned fire at the thieves. Nobody was hurt but he’s under electronic home monitoring
items.description: The former NBA star looked at the ceiling and blew a huff of air when he heard his sentence, which also includes 240 hours of community service.

items.title: It’s so hot in the western U.S. that some people are ‘wobbling’ and collapsing to the ground as they walk outside
items.description: About 1.2 million people were under extreme heat risk, meaning temperatures were expected to stay dangerously high with no relief overnight.

items.title: The last ‘ace’: World War II fighter pilot Donald McPherson, who shot down 5 enemy planes, dies at 103
items.description: McPherson was listed as the conflict's last living U.S. ace by both the American Fighter Aces Association and the Fagen Fighters WWII Museum.

items.title: China Can’t Solve Its Birth Dearth by Throwing Money at the Problem
items.description: State action lowered the birth rate in China, but it won’t be able to raise it — and might, in fact, shrink it even more.
